snippet: Portugal’s new Parliament, which is dominated by the political opposition, will hold a vote that could topple the new austerity-minded minority government.
abstract: Majority opposition in Portugal's Parliament will vote in two weeks on whether to accept agenda, and thus government, of Prime Min Pedro Passos Coelho’s austerity-focused minority center-right coalition.
lead_paragraph: Portugal’s new Parliament, which is dominated by the political opposition, will hold a vote that could topple the new austerity-minded minority government.

headline.print_headline: Europe; Portugal: Minority Government Could Be Voted Out Within Weeks
headline.main: Portugal: Minority Government Could Be Voted Out Within Weeks
